custom_item_1.description: 2.11.20 - Permissions and Ownership - 'home directory permissions do not allow group or world write'
custom_item_1.info: Checking that user home directories are not group or world writable
custom_item_1.name: accounts_bad_home_permissions

custom_item_3.info: Checks the minimum number of characters that are required in a new password which were not in the old password.

custom_item_4.info: Checks the minimum number of weeks before a password can be changed.

custom_item_5.info: Checks the maximum number of weeks that a password is valid.

custom_item_6.info: Checks the minimum length of a password.

custom_item_7.info: Checks the minimum number of alphabetic characters in a password.

custom_item_8.info: Checks the minimum number of non-alphabetic characters in a password.

custom_item_9.info: Checks the maximum number of repeated characters in a password.

custom_item_10.info: Checks the number of weeks that a user will not be able to reuse a password.

custom_item_11.info: Checks the number of previous passwords that a user may not reuse.

custom_item_12.info: Checks the number of weeks after expiration that a user can change their password.

custom_item_13.info: Checks the time interval in seconds when unsuccessful logins must occur to disable a port.

custom_item_14.info: Checks the number of unsuccessful login attempts required before a port will be locked.

custom_item_15.info: Checks the time interval (in minutes) when a port is unlocked after a system lock.

custom_item_16.info: Checks the time interval (in seconds) when a password must be typed in at login.

custom_item_17.info: Checks the delay (in seconds) between each failed login attempt.

custom_item_18.info: Checks the number of attempts a user has to login to the system before their account is disabled.

custom_item_19.info: Checks whether or not the root user can login remotely.

custom_item_20.info: Checks whether root, via su, is restricted to a specific group.

custom_item_21.info: Checks that the owner, group and mode of /etc/inetd.conf are set appropriately.

custom_item_22.info: Checks that the root user has been added to the /etc/ftpusers file.

custom_item_23.description: 1.7.4 - Miscellaneous Enhancements - login herald - 'default herald is set to appropriate text'
custom_item_23.info: Update DEFAULT_HERALD with the appropriate value for the local environment

custom_item_24.info: Checks that the guest account has been removed.

custom_item_25.info: Checking that /usr/sbin/skulker exists and is mode 755

custom_item_26.info: Checking that /usr/lib/spell/compress exists and is mode 755

custom_item_27.info: Checking that /usr/bin/errclear exists and is mode 755

custom_item_28.info: Checking that /usr/lib/ras/dumpcheck exists and is mode 750

custom_item_29.description: 2.2.2 - Configuring SSH - disabling direct root access - 'PermitRootLogin = no'
custom_item_29.info: Checking that /etc/ssh/sshd_config has been edited to disable direct root login.

custom_item_30.info: Checking that /etc/ssh/sshd_config has been edited to allow SSH2 only.

custom_item_31.info: Checking that /etc/ssh/ssh_config has been edited to allow SSH2 only.

custom_item_32.info: Checking that /etc/ssh/sshd_config has been edited to use a login herald.

custom_item_33.info: Checking that /etc/ssh/sshd_config has been edited to ignore .shosts and .rhosts.

custom_item_34.description: 2.2.7 - Configuring SSH - disable null passwords - 'PermitEmptyPasswords = no'
custom_item_34.info: Checking that /etc/ssh/sshd_config has been edited to disallow authenticating users with null passwords.

custom_item_35.description: 2.2.9 - Configuring SSH - set privilege separation - 'UsePrivilegeSeparation = yes'
custom_item_35.info: Checking that /etc/ssh/sshd_config has been edited to ensure that privilege separation is enabled.

custom_item_36.description: 2.2.10 - Configuring SSH - sshd_config permissions lockdown - '/etc/ssh/sshd_config root:system 600'
custom_item_36.info: Checking that /etc/ssh/sshd_config exists and is mode 600

custom_item_37.description: 2.2.11 - Configuring SSH - ssh_config permissions lockdown - '/etc/ssh/ssh_config root:system 644'
custom_item_37.info: Checking that /etc/ssh/sshd_config exists and is mode 644

custom_item_38.info: Checking that /etc/mail/sendmail.cf has been edited to change the default SmtpGreetingMessage.

custom_item_39.info: Checking that /etc/mail/sendmail.cf exists, is owned by root:system and is mode 640

custom_item_40.info: Checking that the /var/spool/mqueue directory exists, is owned by root and is mode 700

custom_item_41.info: Checking that /usr/dt/bin/dtaction is owned by root:sys and is mode 555

custom_item_42.info: Checking that /usr/dt/bin/dtappgather is owned by root:bin and is mode 0555

custom_item_43.info: Checking that dtprintinfo is owned by root:bin and is mode 0555

custom_item_44.info: Checking that dtsession is owned by root:bin and is mode 0555

custom_item_45.info: Checking that files in /usr/dt/config/*/sys.resources have been edited to change the default screensaver timeout.

custom_item_46.info: Checking that files in /usr/dt/config/*/sys.resources have been edited to change the default screensaver lock timeout.

custom_item_47.info: Checking that /etc/dt/config/Xconfig is owned by root:bin and is mode 444

custom_item_48.info: Checking that files in /etc/dt/config/Xconfig has been edited to use the explict path to Xservers.

custom_item_49.info: Checking that /etc/dt/config/Xconfig is owned by root:bin and is mode 444

custom_item_50.description: 2.4.8 - CDE - login screen hostname masking - 'dtlogin*greeting.labelString is set to appropriate text'
custom_item_50.info: NOTE : Update LABEL_STRING with the appropriate value for the local environment

custom_item_51.description: 2.4.8 - CDE - login screen hostname masking - 'dtlogin*greeting.persLabelString is set to appropriate text'
custom_item_51.info: NOTE : Update PERS_LABEL_STRING with the appropriate value for the local environment

custom_item_52.info: Checking that /etc/dt/config/*Xresources files are owned by root:sys and are mode 444

custom_item_53.description: 2.5.2 - NFS - no suid on NFS client mounts - 'All NFS client mounts have nosuid option'
custom_item_53.info: Checking that all NFS mounts in /etc/filesystems have the nosuid option set.

custom_item_54.description: 2.5.3 - NFS - localhost removal - 'no localhost references exist in /etc/exports'
custom_item_54.info: Checking that no entries in /etc/exports have references to localhost

custom_item_55.description: 2.5.5 - NFS - no_root_squash option - 'no anon options exist in /etc/exports'
custom_item_55.info: Checking that items in /etc/exports do not have anon options

custom_item_56.info: Checking that /etc/hosts.deny has been created and configured

custom_item_57.info: Checking that /etc/hosts.deny is owned by root:system and is mode 600

custom_item_58.info: NOTE : Update ALLOWED_HOST with the appropriate value for the local environment

custom_item_64.info: Checking that /audit directory is owned by root:audit and is mode 750

custom_item_66.info: Checking that /var/adm/cron/log is owned by root:cron and is mode 660

custom_item_67.info: Checking that /var/spool/cron/crontabs/ is owned by root:cron and is mode 770

custom_item_68.info: Checking that /var/adm/cron/at.allow is owned by root:sys and is mode 400

custom_item_69.info: Checking that /var/adm/cron/cron.allow is owned by root:sys and is mode 400

custom_item_70.info: Checking that /etc/motd is owned by bin:bin and is mode 644

custom_item_71.description: 2.11.12 - Permissions and Ownership - '/var/adm/ras/* files are not world readable or writable'
custom_item_71.info: Checking that /var/adm/ras/* does not allow reading or writing by others

custom_item_72.info: Checking that /var/ct/RMstart.log is owned by root:system and is mode 640

custom_item_73.info: Checking that /var/tmp/dpid2.log is owned by root:system and is mode 640

custom_item_74.info: Checking that /var/tmp/hostmibd.log is owned by root:system and is mode 640

custom_item_75.info: Checking that /var/tmp/snmpd.log is owned by root:system and is mode 640

custom_item_76.info: Checking that /var/adm/sa directory is owned by adm:adm and is mode 755

custom_item_77.description: 2.11.18 - Permissions and Ownership - 'no group or world writable directories in root PATH'
custom_item_77.info: Checking that no group or world writeable directories exist in the root user's executable path.
custom_item_77.cmd: echo /:${PATH} | tr ':' '\\n' | while read DIR; do DIR=${DIR:-$(pwd)}; while [[ -d ${DIR} ]]; do [[ $(ls -ld ${DIR}) = @(d???????w? *) ]] && print "WARNING ${DIR} is world writable"; [[ $(ls -ld ${DIR}) = @(d????w???? *) ]] && print "WARNING ${DIR} is group writable"; [[ $(ls -ld ${DIR} | awk '{print $3}') != @(root|bin) ]] && print "WARNING ${DIR} is not owned by root or bin"; DIR=${DIR%/*}; done; done
